fields.summary: As a user, I want to view reviewers in Jira in the People section of the full view and in the Card view.
Provide more information before starting a reindex

fields.description:
I see in [the documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-Wholewordsonly] that searches can only be performed by whole words.

Because of this, if I have email submissions from joe.smith@example.com, I can search for "joe.smith@example.com", but there's no way to find all submissions from "example.com".

Could the indexer be changed to index both joe.smith@example.com and example.com in this case?

(This is not the same request as JRA-22941; that's asking to search reporters by domain name, while I'm asking to search comments and descriptions by domain name.)
fields.summary: Enable searching comments and descriptions by email domain
Extend support for ActionsAndOperations JavaScript to handle non-issue dropdowns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25364].
  {panel}

Hi ,

(When using AD for user management)
When the user is not added to jira-users group.
That is, when the user does not have the permission to delete a link between issues, and he tries to click on the 'Recycle bin' icon.
Nothing happens and the interface does not give any hint to the user about the permissions that he is missing.

It would be great if there were an error message saying "You do not have permissions to delete a link."

Thanks,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Error message on deleting link between issues : You do not have permissions to delete a link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25361].
  {panel}

Make the JIRA Configuration Tool's '*Save*' button only save the configuration of the currently-selected tab.

The [JIRA Config Tool|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool] is a convenient, multi-purpose tool, which our various installation and upgrade procedures make extensive use of.

However, one annoying aspect of this tool is that clicking the '*Save*' button saves all of its configurations (across all tabs, no matter what tab the '*Save*' button is clicked on), including:
# The location of the *JIRA Home Directory* (stored in the {{jira-application.properties}} file within the *JIRA Installation Dierctory*).
# The database connection (stored in the {{dbconfig.xml}} file of the *JIRA Home Directory*).
# The TCP ports that JIRA runs through (stored in the {{server.xml}} file within the *JIRA Installation Dierctory*).

When customers upgrade or install JIRA (using one of the manual upgrade/installation procedures), they can use this tool to perform the first two configurations above (the latter of which may require manual configuration of the {{dbconfig.xml}} file for specialised db setups). Manual configuration of the {{dbconfig.xml}} file might be required because those particular configurations are not supported by the JIRA Configuration Tool.

However, if the customer were to perform the JIRA Home Directory configuration step _after_ defining a finely tuned DB connection (in a 'specialised' {{dbconfig.xml}} file which they manually configured), their specialised {{dbconfig.xml}} will be overwritten because the '*Save*' button on the JIRA Configuration Tool saves the configs on _all_ tabs - regardless of whether you like it or not. End result? They'll then lose their finely tuned configurations.

Hence, please make the '*Save*' button only apply to the configuration tab its used on. Intuitively, many users would also expect the '*Save*' button to behave this way - and it ultimately results in greater flexibility for them too.
fields.summary: Make the JIRA Configuration Tool's 'Save' button only save the configuration of the currently selected tab.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

JIRA's notification sheme should have recipients and cc.
Jira installer to ask user about action on creating a new jira user
JIRA should not count Crowd users that are set as inactive on Crowd side as a licensed user

fields.description:
Sometimes it is helpful to look for issues in Jira that have certain relationship between other elements in other Atlassian products. For example, doing a search to list all Jira issues that do *not* have a Crucible code review associated with them. As I understand it this is not currently possible.

Where one of the strengths / selling points of Atlassian products is their integration with Jira this seems like a logical extension to the current JQL APIs.
fields.summary: Allow JQL to query other Atlassian products

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25342].
  {panel}

Jira's URL encoding scheme is incompatible with some web servers, notably IIS 7.5. By default, IIS disallows 'double encoding'. Jira uses this 'double encoding' to replace spaces in the names of file attachments with '+' characters. This causes an error (404 Not Found) when Jira is proxied through IIS with Application Request Routing and URL Rewriting (this is the normal situation with Windows Server 2008 and IIS 7). There is a workaround, but it requires weakening of the default security policy of IIS, which is never easy to swallow.

Using '+' to represent spaces is not universally accepted as a valid practice. The more technically correct (but ugly) encoding of %20 would be safer in a wider variety of situations.

I would like to see Atlassian products use this standard encoding practice.

For background information, please see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-85127
fields.summary: URL encoding of spaces
Usability Improvement: Highlight Issue "Key" Fields in Issue Viewer Screen
Configure Global Logo Width And Height In JIRA 4.4

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25332].
  {panel}

BonFire ended up throw an exception (during restore) and once that is done JIRA is busted forever.  We should use try/catch around the module output to stop this happening.

Also be careful about logging since  a poisoned plugin will log on every page view.

h1.Workaround
Remove the incompatible Bonfire plugin at {{JIRA _HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} and restart JIRA
fields.summary: Top navigation plugin point can't handle exceptions and once it's busted it's busted forever

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25330].
  {panel}

[Setting Up a SQL Server 2005 database for JIRA|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+Up+a+SQL+Server+2005+database+for+JIRA] provides step by step instruction on how to configure db server with schema called _jiraschema_. Where [Connecting JIRA to SQL Server 2005|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2005#ConnectingJIRAtoSQLServer2005-2.CreateandConfiguretheSQLServerDatabase] & [Connecting JIRA to SQL Server 2008|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008#ConnectingJIRAtoSQLServer2008-2.CreateandConfiguretheSQLServerDatabaserefers] to a schema called _dbo_.

Also when running ./config.sh the SQL Server configuration will default a schema to dbo, this makes me think that it should be what is the recommended schema, but it may be best to discuss with a developer just to check exactly what should be the recommended schema, weather it be dbo or jiraschema.

Within this documantation:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+Up+a+SQL+Server+2005+database+for+JIRA
If it's dbo then this schema is already created and the schema need only be associated with the DB user and permissions need to be assigned to that user.
if it's jiraschema then this documentation can stay the same and it will need to be changed elsewhere.

_Note_ this change was introduced in doco for JIRA 4.4.

This inconsistency is likely to cause unnecessary confusion for less experienced db admins who in fact were are trying to help in here :)
fields.summary: inconsistent naming convenience for db schema
Add keyboard shortcut for "assign to me"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25325].
  {panel}

Hi,

A customer just noticed the following behavior on JIRA 4.4

# Create a new Project in Administration.
# View the project Summary.
# Click Issue Types tab.
# Click pencil button to Change Scheme.
# Make a selection and Save.
# You are taken to the Issue Types administration screen.

You should actually be taken back to the Project screen.

Regards,
Ruchi
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Updating a change to the Issue Type Scheme for a Project returns to the Issue Type screen instead of the Project screen
Provide "tag wiki" features to add description and redirection to tag
addComment returns nothing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25304].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

Welcome to the JIRA 5.0 Early Access Program (EAP)!

Thanks for trying out our early look at our next release.  You can download the latest EAP release (milestone build, beta or release candidate) [here|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/EAPDownloads.jspa].

We really appreciate you taking the time to provide us any feedback on the contents of the EAP.

Simply comment below for any comments you may have.

Cheers,
Bryan Rollins
JIRA Product Management
fields.summary: EAP Feedback - JIRA 5.0
Administer Timezone settings
Restore issue-type-specific custom field values when moving an issue to a new project or changing type
Should be able to make reporter inviolable
Add title text to workflow lozenges
Support fuzzy matching for the Labels field.
Installer needs to validate suitability of used OS (32 bit v 64bit)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25277].
  {panel}

On upgrade Installer detects modification detection to {{atlassian-jira}}. In JIRA 4.4 Tomcat's configuration files such as {{server.xml}} are excluded from the check. Moreover, users are not provided with any warning or feedback from Installer requesting them to manually migrate any changes from used {{server.xml}} across to its equivalent in JIRA 4.4.

Significant number of our customers modify {{server.xml}} to provide HTTPS or AJP and some of them are likely to miss our warning in the upgrade guide. Therefore installer should help them avoid this 'simile' configuration problem in order to streamline their upgrade process.

Originally reported issue below:
{quote}
_Automated upgrade, when using the installer, erases SSL and IIS configurations_

Hey guys,

So, on the new 4.4 JIRA, when you install it using the installer, you are promtped to upgrade an existing install. If this install is working already with SSL or IIS, after the upgrade is done, all these working confugurations stopped working.

So, steps to reproduce:
- make a JIRA pre 4.4 use SSL or IIS
- upgrade this existing install via Windows installer
- try to access JIRA

Any updates on this would be great!

Cheers

Thiago Prisco
{quote}
fields.summary: On upgrade Installer needs to migrate content of server.xml  or warn users
Auth token expires too quickly; no way to configure alternative time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25264].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Open the {{jira-application.properties}}, set the {{ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions = 0}}
# Restart JIRA
# The default number (2) of workflow transition is shown. The setting does not take effect

*Expectation:*
I'm expecting that all the workflow transitions will show in the drop down list (there should not have any workflow transition shown before the 'Workflow' button)

*Additional feature:*
The setting should be configured for project level as each project having different workflows
fields.summary: Add ability to set the size of the 'Workflow' group in the 'Operations' bar to 0

fields.summary: When we edit a filter and save it, the operation is not usability.
Cannot find my issue when operate to link issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25250].
  {panel}

I've been toying around with ideas for the JIRA menu bar to improve some minor problems with it:

* the disabled "More Actions" and "Workflow" buttons are unnecessary when additional actions or workflow aren't present
* the "More" button labels are the only way the user can tell which button group relates to which functionality: actions or workflow.

Therefore, my suggestion is to:

* add a label before each button group on the toolbar, "Actions" and "Workflow"
* hide the "More" button if it's unnecessary
* remove the now-unnecessary additional word on the More button.

See the attached screenshots, before and after, prepared with a few tweaks in Firebug. 

(I think we could also improve the spacing around the menu indicator on the More button. In the new design screenshot, it pretty obvious that it has too much space on either side.)
fields.summary: Improve JIRA issue button bar by hiding unnecessary "More" buttons and adding labels for button groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25238].
  {panel}

The Downloads page for JIRA with OSX recommends:

JIRA 4.4 Standalone (Linux 64 Bit Installer)

but in fact the documentation for OSX at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Standalone+on+Mac+OS+X says to use the Standalone version, i.e.

JIRA 4.4 Standalone (TAR.GZ Archive)

As it stands, people are downloading an installer that doesn't work for them. They have to choose "Show All" to get the correct version to download.
fields.summary: Recommended OSX download version for JIRA 4.4 is the wrong one

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25234].
  {panel}

Install to Run as Windows Services										
	.shutdown.bat Confluence, JIRA, Crowd									
										
	.rc.Edit.C:\8atl\crowd\apache-tomcat\bin\service.bat 									
		rem Set default Service name								
		set SERVICE_NAME=AtlCrowdTomcat6								
		set PR_DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian Crowd								
		set PR_DESCRIPTION=Atlassian Crowd Server - http://localhost:8095/								
	.Shift.rc.C:\8atl\crowd\apache-tomcat\bin.Command Prompt									
		 >service.bat install								
										
	.rc.Edit.C:\8atl\jira\bin\service.bat 									
		rem Set default Service name								
		set SERVICE_NAME=AtlJIRATomcat6								
		set PR_DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian JIRA								
		set PR_DESCRIPTION=Atlassian JIRA Server - http://localhost:8080/								
	.Shift.rc.C:\8atl\jira\bin.Command Prompt									
		 >service.bat install								
										
	.rc.Edit.C:\8atl\confluence\bin\service.bat 									
		rem Set default Service name								
		set SERVICE_NAME=AtlConfluenceTomcat6								
		set PR_DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian Confluence								
		set PR_DESCRIPTION=Atlassian Confluence Server - http://localhost:8090/								
	.Shift.rc.C:\8atl\confluence\bin.Command Prompt									
		 >service.bat install								
										
	Setup Service dependencies									
		HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Crowd								
			.rc.Edit.DependOnService.Add.postgresql-8.4							
		Repeat for JIRA, Confluence								
			.rc.Edit.DependOnService.Add.AtlCrowdTomcat6							
										
	.Services.Set all to Automatic									
.Restart
fields.summary: Configure JIRA, Confluence and Crowd to run as a Windows Service

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25216].
  {panel}

The password reset token may be leaked via the referrer header to untrusted sources.  Here are some potential attack scenarios:

# Admin sets their JIRA logo to be a logo sourced from an untrusted site (this is not usually considered an issue)
# A user forgets their password and requests a password reset email, and clicks the link in an issue.  Alternatively, the admin of the untrusted site requests password reset for a victim, and hopes they click the link, which could happen.
# The user is taken to the password reset screen, the logo is requested and the referrer header from that logo contains the password reset token
# The site the logo comes from uses that referrer header to reset the users password before the user has an opportunity to

Other potential scenarios are that the admin sets the JIRA logo to a trusted static site who, because their site is static and contains no confidential information, leaves their webstats unprotected.

A good solution to this problem is when receiving a password reset request from an email, store the token in the session, and redirect the user to another screen that asks for a new password, and doesn't put the token in the URL.
fields.summary: Leaking of password reset tokens via referrer header
WAR distribution script and process for creating WAR file must be changed now that we use dbconfig.xml instead of entityengine.xml

1. Enter incorrect db setting values
2. Hit "Test Connection" (should see error message)
3. Fix up db setting values
4. Hit "Next"

The setup process should continue, however the error messages in Step2 are still there - would be nice to either remove them or display "connection successful".

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25210].
  {panel}

In the initial JIRA start we don't allow users to point to a db with existing data when configuring connection.
Currently we show an error, we need to modify the error message and add a link to upgrade documentation. Something like  "The database specified is not empty. Please specify an empty database for your JIRA installation. If you want to upgrade the existing installation please follow this instructions." where 'this instructions' is a link to a documentation page.

h3. Workaround

# Stop JIRA.
# Manually alter the {{$JIRA_HOME/dbconfig.xml}} or use the [JIRA Configuration Tool|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool] to point to the database.
(!) Please ensure to follow the appropriate documentation for [Connecting JIRA to a Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+a+Database].
# Start JIRA.
fields.summary: Point users to upgrade documentation if they try to connect to db with existing jira data.

Following warning is dropped into log file due to misbehaving plugin.
{noformat}
2011-02-17 09:39:12,163 http-8080-5 WARN xxxxxxx 579x6004x1 1b7w9ft 192.179.113.217 /secure/IssueNavigator.jspa [velocity] org.apache.velocity.runtime.exception.ReferenceException: reference : template = getEncodedBodyFromContent [line 1,column 71] : ${issue.id} is not a valid reference.
 at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.render(ASTReference.java:277)
 at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:230)
 at org.apache.velocity.app.VelocityEngine.evaluate(VelocityEngine.java:300)
 at org.apache.velocity.app.VelocityEngine.evaluate(VelocityEngine.java:202)
 at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.getEncodedBodyForContent(DefaultVelocityManager.java:143)

{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25182].
  {panel}

Hi all,

We need to update our JIRA upgrade documentation for error java.sql.SQLException: ORA-12899.
The customer is getting the following error during XML import when using Oracle database with utf8.

{code}2011-07-13 17:12:48,832 pool-5-thread-3 ERROR anonymous 1025x39x1 1uyf1my 10.10.10.217,10.10.10.217 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [jira.action.admin.OfbizImportHandler] Exception importing entity: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Issue][summary,Anasayfa linkini kullanarak anasayfaya dönüldükten sonra, anasayfadan yatırımcı menusune dönülmek istendiğinde doğrudan Mobil Hizmet Tanımlamarı sayfasına dönmektedir. Yatırımcı Bilgilendirme Hizmetleri ilk ekranına dönmesi sağlanmalıdır.][status,6][votes,0][assignee,asuner][resolution,1][type,10][resolutiondate,2008-09-05 15:44:08.0][id,35451][reporter,asuner][project,10310][created,2008-09-04 14:41:11.0][updated,2008-09-17 09:23:58.0][workflowId,166741][priority,5][key,WYP-78] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO jiraissue (ID, pkey, PROJECT, REPORTER, ASSIGNEE, issuetype, SUMMARY, DESCRIPTION, ENVIRONMENT, PRIORITY, RESOLUTION, issuestatus, CREATED, UPDATED, DUEDATE, RESOLUTIONDATE, VOTES, TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE, TIMEESTIMATE, TIMESPENT, WORKFLOW_ID, SECURITY, FIXFOR, COMPONENT) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ORA-12899: value too large for column "JIRATEST"."JIRAISSUE"."SUMMARY" (actual: 260, maximum: 255)
)){code}

The *solution* for the problem is :

When creating an empty database, if database is created using
"NLS_LENGTH_SEMANTICS = CHAR" in (NLS_DATABASE_PARAMETERS or nls_session_parameters) then there is no problem in XML Import.

Refereces:
* http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/B19306_01/server.102/b14220/datatype.htm
* http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/B19306_01/server.102/b14237/initparams127.htm
fields.summary: Documentation needed for upgrade error java.sql.SQLException: ORA-12899

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25179].
  {panel}

When adding/editing a workflow transition, it is not possible to add an individual condition which is separate from the outermost grouped condition. Instead, clicking the '*Add*' link (at the top left of the transition's 'Conditions' tab) simply adds your individual condition to the outermost grouped condition.

This makes it cumbersome to add an individual condition _independently_ of the outermost grouped condition and then switch the logic of this individual condition (_independently_ of the outermost grouped condition).

For example, I have an outermost grouped condition consisting of (A AND B AND C) to which I want to add the individual condition D.

After using the '*Add*' link to add D, I get '(A AND B AND C AND D)' - not '(A AND B AND C) AND D'.

*Why is this distinction important?* Because if I wanted to switch the logic of the original grouped condition only, I'd get '(A OR B OR C OR D)' - not '(A OR B OR C) AND D', the latter of which:
* is intuitively what I'd intended
* would be a valid (complex) condition.

To get the latter (complex) condition, I'd have to do the following - assuming I'm starting with the grouped condition (A AND B AND C):
# Click the '*Add grouped condition*' link (against A) to add B and C to A, so I get ((A AND B AND C) AND B AND C).
# Click the '*Add*' link at the top-left (or the outermost group's '*Add condition to group*' link) to add D to the outermost group, which gives me ((A AND B AND C) AND B AND C AND D).
# Click the '*Delete*' link (against B and C in the outermost group) to remove B and C from the outermost group, which finally gives me ((A AND B AND C) AND D).
# I can then go ahead and switch the logic of the internal group to give me ((A OR B OR C) AND D).

This is an unnecessarily complex set of steps to generate this fairly straightforward complex condition.

----

To resolve this issue, the '*Add*' link at the top-left (mentioned in step 2 above) should always add individual conditions that are 'external to' the outermost group. *Reason?* - you can always add D to an outermost group (A AND B AND C) using the '*Add condition to group*' link.
fields.summary: When adding/editing a workflow transition, it is not possible to add an individual condition which is separate from the outermost grouped condition.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25178].
  {panel}

At the moment, JIRA's autocomplete isn't very useful for fast typists because it appears slowly on large servers like JAC. But the more irritating problem is that when a slow response comes back for the autocomplete, it can pop up after you've left the autocomplete field, obscuring other content on the form.

I'd suggest one of two possible implementation fixes:

* when the autocomplete returns, check whether the relevant field is active before displaying the dropdown
* when the field is blurred (loses focus), cancel any outstanding autocomplete actions on that field.
fields.summary: Autocomplete on issue links, user pickers, etc. should be cancelled when form field is exited
A form with an error should be considered to be dirty and prompt if the user leaves the page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25166].
  {panel}

Documentation says:
bq. The custom field context allows your custom field to be configured differently for numerous different combinations of issue types and projects. For example, your custom field could have *different default values for different projects (and/or issue types).*

I want to emphasize the _*(and/or issue types)*_. This seems to imply that you can set multiple default values within the same project for different issue types.

After some testing, I found that once you have selected and configured a specific project/issue type combination, you cannot select that same project again for editing.  This means that you cannot set the 'different values' for a different set of issue types within that same project.

Example:
* I have the project 'ape planet' and want to create a custom select field with values A, B, C for the 'Bug' issue type and values 1, 2, 3 for the 'Improvement' issue type of this project.
* As shown below I did the following:
** Created the new custom field select type, selecting 'Bug' and 'ape planet' context.
** I then clicked 'Add new context' to now configure the 'Improvement' issue type, but I find that 'ape planet' project can no longer be selected.
fields.summary: Context cannot set different values for different issue types within the same project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25165].
  {panel}

h3.Problem
JIRA is misguiding the place where the xml backup should be.

_By default JIRA will use the index path specified in the backup file. The following path will be used for backups without an index path: JIRA-Home\jira_434\caches\indexes_

Where actually the real place is _JIRA-Home\jira_434\import_

h3.Fix
There is none yet.

h3.Workaround
Place the file inside here _JIRA-Home\jira_434\import_
fields.summary: JIRA "Import Existing Data" file location is wrong.

  {panel}

Whatever the reasons are that JIRA source code is made available, it's less useful if it isn't the complete source code for the JIRA application as shipped. 
I think that if a plugin ships with JIRA, its source code should ship along with the JIRA source code. 

Affected plugins: JIRA SOAP RPC, JIRA Importers, others?

If the source code for such plugins isn't shipped, then some file needs to contain links to where to get it.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25151].
  {panel}

Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
*In JIRA 4.1.2*
# Create 2 issues
# Link between these 2 issues
# There is an 'Eye' icon where you can Manage Link
# Clicking on that 'Eye' icon will redirect you to another page where you can delete the link 
# The default value for *jira.table.cols.linkedissue* which controls this display in {{jira-application.properties}} file is issuetype, issuekey, summary, status, priority 
# If we add in an Assignee to this *jira.table.cols.linkedissue*, the Assignee field is able to show up inside the Manage Links page upon the next restart:
{noformat}
...
# The columns to view when viewing issues in a table.  The values that you can put
# here are valid values from IssueFieldConstants.
jira.table.cols.linkedissue = issuetype, issuekey, summary, status, priority, assignee
...
{noformat}

*In JIRA 4.3.x onwards*
# Create 2 issues
# Link between these 2 issues
# As there are no more 'Eye' icon anymore due to this new [implementation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.3+Release+Notes#JIRA4.3ReleaseNotes-ImprovementstoIssueLinks], we can now delete the link directly on the issue page itself without taking us to a separate screen like in JIRA 4.1.2
# Checking at {{jira-application.properties}} file, the default value for *jira.table.cols.linkedissue* is still the same
# However, if we add in an Assignee to this *jira.table.cols.linkedissue*, the Assignee field is not able to show up on the 'Linked Issues' section of the 'View Issue' screen 
|

To conclude, it seems like it is no longer taking any effect with the following value inside {{jira-application.properties}} file in JIRA 4.3.x:
{noformat}
...
# The columns to show when viewing issues in a table (eg. the 'Linked Issues' section on the 'View Issue' page).
# The values that you can put here are valid values from IssueFieldConstants.
#
jira.table.cols.linkedissue = issuetype, issuekey, summary, status, priority, assignee
...
{noformat}

I am not sure if the new implementation to the issue links was meant disable this value inside {{jira-application.properties}} file but this may look like a bug as it is not working as intended.
fields.summary: Unable to configure visible fields in Linked Issue columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25149].
  {panel}

When you hover a transition button on an issue with the mouse the tooltip shows the name and the description of the transition.

However when you click on the button, the transition-edit-window which is shown does not show the description.

It would be nice if the descrition was shown there too as it allows to give an explanation of what this transition does.

In the meanwhile the only workaround is to use the "Message Custom Field (for edit)" from the "Jira Tools" plugin which is not a very convenient solution.
fields.summary: Display description of transition in transition screen
Introduce "X-XSS-Protection" HTTP header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25143].
  {panel}

TLDR: Add X-FRAME-Options: SAMEORIGIN to all HTTP(S) pages (server config), and test that nothing breaks.
---
Description: Current HTTP headers do not contain the X-FRAME-Option, which helps prevents against Clickjacking attacks. A Clickjacking attack is similar to CSRF in which attacker can hijack a "click" on a web application from another "invisible" frame in the browser. Essentially, an attacker can force a user to click on a button that is invisible to him/her.

Exploit Scenario: An attacker crafts a malicious page such that when their victim clicks, they are actually clicking on the link or button in the vulnerable application hosted in an iframe. Thus, an attacker tricks the user into performing an action of the attacker's choosing by directing mouse input to the target application.
fields.summary: Enable X-FRAME-Options header to implement clickjacking protection
Allow JIRA administrators to import XML workflows
Don't prompt for unnecessary status mapping changes in workflow migration
Applying filter for Quick Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25122].
  {panel}

When upgrading from JIRA 4.0.2 to 4.3.3 the JIRA database upgrade process that is run on first startup performs four separate reindex operations, all four of which are extraneous for a typical upgrade and incur many hours of critical down time for large JIRA instances.  Due to the fact that JIRA upgrades often involve admin-level changes that are going to require a manual re-index to be performed anyway, it is unnecessary for JIRA to perform a reindex at all as part of the database upgrade process, and it is definitely unnecessary for it to perform 4 of them.  Please optimize this so at most one (optional) reindex is performed during the upgrade process.

To work around this problem we removed the jira.option.indexing row from the propertyentry table in the JIRA database before starting the upgraded version of JIRA for the first time.  After the upgrade is complete, go to Administration->Indexing in the JIRA interface and click "Activate" to re-add this row to the database and manually begin the reindexing process.  Using this procedure resulted in a 50-minute upgrade process instead of nearly 5 hours.  Your mileage may vary, but we did not notice any problems created by using this procedure.

Please also update the JIRA documentation to note that the jira.option.indexing parameter in jira-application.properties no longer performs any function in an unmodified JIRA instance.  (This setting in jira-application.properties is always overridden by the database entry, if present.)

h3. Workaround

(i) This only applies for instances pre 5.0 and should only ever be required if upgrading from a version of JIRA prior to 4.0 (e.g.: a two-step from 3.13.x to 4.4.5). Otherwise upgrading to the most recent version will contain this improvement.

# Disable the indexing:
{code:SQL}
UPDATE propertynumber ps, 
       propertyentry pe 
SET    ps.propertyvalue = 0 
WHERE  pe.id = ps.id 
       AND pe.entity_name = 'jira.properties' 
       AND pe.propertytype = 1 
       AND pe.property_key = 'jira.option.indexing'
{code}
# Complete the upgrade and test.
# Re-enable the argument:
{code:SQL}
UPDATE propertynumber ps, 
       propertyentry pe 
SET    ps.propertyvalue = 1
WHERE  pe.id = ps.id 
       AND pe.entity_name = 'jira.properties' 
       AND pe.propertytype = 0 
       AND pe.property_key = 'jira.option.indexing'
{code}
fields.summary: Optimize the reindexing process when upgrading thru multiple versions of JIRA
Modify Workflow Scheme for multiple projects at once
Allow to change the Workflow Scheme name
Allow to import multiple projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25114].
  {panel}

Whilst the ultimate aim is to remove *Step Name (id)s* from JIRA altogether, JIRA 4.4 still depends on this field being around. However, this situation seems to be causing the following issue with the VWD...

In the original Workflow Steps Editor, when you attempt to add a new step (with a matching *Step Name* and *Linked Status*) to a workflow containing an existing step with exactly the same *Step Name (id)* (but not necessarily the same *Linked Status*), JIRA won't let you because you can't have two or more steps with the same *Step Name (id)*. (Actually, the matching *Step Name* and *Linked Status* might be superfluous here.)

However, in the VWD, if you:
# Add a new status in the Status Editor (with the same *Step Name (id)* as an existing step in the workflow, which happens to have a different *Linked Status*).
# Drag-and-drop your newly created status from the Status Editor to your workflow (which adds a new step with a matching *Step Name (id)* and *Linked Status* to the workflow)...

the VWD will allow this despite the presence of an identical step with *Step Name (id)* in the workflow. In other words, there appears to be no validation based on *Step Name (id)* in the VWD.

This has two effects:
* When you attempt to delete the duplicate step you added, JIRA returns a service error (detailed in the comment below).
* You'll end up with two steps in the workflow steps editor with identical *Step Name (ids)*, which this editor would have prevented.
fields.summary: The VWD does not validate the addition of Statuses by their 'Step Name (id)' - which can lead to duplicate step names and 'Java Service Fault' errors.

  {panel}

Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. In Admin, goto the projects page.
3. Click on the "Delete" link. User is shown the websudo dialog.
4. Enter the password.

Result:
1. User is back on "projects" page.
fields.summary: Clicking on "Delete" link for project, takes user back to the Projects page after websudo authentication.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25107].
  {panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hello,

This is fixed. Now, if you add a component with lead as "    ", no error is shown while editing that component.

Thanks,
Jira cloud product management

{panel}

We handle spaces for the component lead on the Components tab in an inconsistent way. 

For example:
* Add a component with lead "          "
* The component is added successfully

However, if we:
* Edit an existing component and put in a lead of "         "
* An error is thrown with "The user does not exist"
fields.summary: Inconsistent behaviour when adding and editing component lead with spaces
Some email notifcations don't thread properly because the second one is missing an In-Reply-To header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25092].
  {panel}

If you attempt to search JIRA issues for special characters (in text fields), using properly escaped special character syntax (see [our documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-EscapingSpecialCharactersor] on *Escaping Special Characters* when performing text searches for details), *no results* are retrieved, even when JIRA issues containing these characters (in the relevant text fields) actually do exist.

It seems this problem is a bug (and that this functionality should exist in JIRA) because when you attempt to perform a Simple or Quick search like:
{code}
\[
{code}
and you switch to Advanced search, this search term gets resolved to the properly escaped JQL syntax:
{code}
summary ~ "\\[" OR description ~ "\\[" OR comment ~ "\\["
{code}

Further to this it's been found that not only escaping [ does not work, but other characters don't escape correctly.

----

We tested the following special characters in [our documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-EscapingSpecialCharactersor] only to find that most of them do not work:
{code}
one+ two- three& four| five! six( seven) eight{ nine} ten[ eleven] twelve^ thirteen~ fifteen* sixteen? seventeen\
{code}
Doing special character searches have the following problems with escaping:
{code}
summary ~ "one\\+" (works)
summary ~ "two\\-" (works)
summary ~ "three\\&" (works)
summary ~ "four\\|" (works)
summary ~ "five\\!" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "six\\(" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "seven\\)" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "eight\\{" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "nine\\}" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "ten\\[" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "eleven\\]" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "twelve\\^" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "thirteen\\~" (works)
summary ~ "fifteen\\*" (works)
summary ~ "sixteen\\?" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "seventeen\u005C" (doesn't work) (special case where \\\ does not work either)
{code}
fields.summary: Searching JIRA issues for special characters (in text fields) does not work, even if these characters have been properly escaped in a quick, simple or advanced (i.e. JQL) search.
The weight in workflow-function module is assumed as unique key in AddWorkflowTransition
